docs.title: Pheno-Ranker-UI Documentation
docs.text:
Pheno-Ranker logo

Welcome to the documentation for Pheno-Ranker-UI!

About

This documentation provides instructions and guidelines for installing and using a software tool specifically designed for performing semantic similarity search on JSON|YAML files (and CSV).

Disclaimer

This software is still in development (beta) phase. Further testing and refinement are required before it can be considered fully operational. Until then, it is not recommended to use it in any production environments.

docs.title: General
docs.text:
What does Pheno-Ranker-UI do?

Pheno-ranker-ui is a web-interface for the CPAN's module Pheno::Ranker which is a tool designed for performing semantic similarity analysis on phenotypic data structured in JSON format, such as Beacon v2 Models or Phenopackets v2.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
I have troubles to self-host Pheno-Ranker-UI

We feel you. It can be indeed quite daunting sometimes to make an application working which comprises of multiple microservices. Make sure that you were following the instructions carefully. If you still have troubles, please open an issue and we will try to help you.

docs.title: Playground
docs.text:
If you want to try Pheno-Ranker-UI out we will providing a playground

In order to access there is no need to register, just use the following credentials:

  • username: pheno
  • password: ranker

Use

The playground has only one user so all the files uploaded will be visible to everyone. So please do not upload any sensitive data.

docs.title: Pre-requisites
docs.text:
• Ideally a unix (GNU/Linux, MacOS) based distribution
  • Docker and Docker Compose compose installed

docs.title: Methods for running the UI
docs.text:
First get the latest version of the code from the repository 

git clone https://github.com/CNAG-Biomedical-Informatics/pheno-ranker-ui.git

Quick start (no SSL & user authentication)For self-hosters (SSL and keycloak-based user authentication)
  • rename the file example.env to .env and fill in the variables
  • Run docker compose up -d
  • Open your browser and go to localhost most likely you will get a warning about the certificate, just accept it

Pheno-Ranker is designed to be run as a collection of microservices.

Please consult the dev_docs in the repository for more information.

docs.title: Supported formats
docs.text: Format File Type Beacon v2 Models JSON Phenopacket v2 Models JSON

docs.title: Tutorial
docs.text:
Simulate pheno-clinical data

After being logged in with the user pheno and password ranker you can start your Pheno-Ranker instance.

A pheno-clinical data simulation is a 5-step process:

  1. Select under Utilities the Simulate BFF/PXF option

Hint

Hover over utilities and the right click on Simulate BFF/PXF to open the link in a new tab. Now the url bar will show extra information about which mode is currently selected etc.

  1. Select the ouptut formats (bff/pxf)
  2. Set the number of individuals to be generated
  3. Either upload an ontologies yaml file or modify the ontologies in the editor below
  4. Select one or multiple output formats
  5. Click on the Simulate button

Use example data selected

docs.title: What is Pheno-Ranker-UI?
docs.text:
is a web-interface for Pheno-Ranker, a software toolkit that performs semantic similarity in PXF/BFF data structures and beyond.

Use

Pheno-Ranker-UI can be accessed in three ways:

  • Playground
  • Run locally
